verbose_text: Cytotoxic (CD8 positive) T cells are activated by products of the class I major histocompatibility genes (HLA-A and -B), which are expressed on the surface of antigen presenting cells if microbial proliferation proceeds unchecked within phagocytes, the bacteria containing phagocytes then being eliminated by the T cells.
